description: Rear extension at lower ground floor level, insertion of low-level air brick extraction point to front elevation, replacement of existing window to rear at ground floor level with a door to access a roof terrace (with balustrade) and stairs down to the garden. Internal alterations. (Planning consent application reference P101373 also submitted.)
decision_conditions: REASON: The proposed external additions and alterations to the historic fabric of the building are considered be harmful to the special interest, architectural character and appearance of the listed building and the character and appearance of the Duncan Terrace/Colebrooke Row Conservation Area contrary to the objectives of PPS5 Planning and the Historic Environment, policies D1 (Overall design), D4 (Designing in context), D11 (Alterations and extensions), D28 (Rear Extensions) of the Islington Unitary Development Plan 2002 and guidance contained within the Colebrooke Row/Duncan Terrace Conservation Area Design Guidelines 2002.
